message: This is a great opportunity to get a fantastic product at an unbeatable price! I'm offering it to you for just $100, which is a steal considering its usual market value is much higher. I'm confident you'll love it!
I'm not sure if it's a good deal, can you tell me the product's quality before I make a decision?

Ahaha, I see you're a savvy buyer! I understand your concerns, but I assure you that this product is top-notch. I'm willing to offer it to you for the same price of $100, which is still an incredible deal considering its true value. Trust me, you won't find a better deal anywhere else!
I appreciate your confidence in the product, but I'm not convinced. Can you give me some more information about the product's quality or tell me the result of the previous product you offered me?

I understand your hesitation, but I can assure you that the previous product was indeed a low-quality item. It was a one-off mistake, and I've since ensured that our quality control measures are in place to prevent such instances. As for this new product, I can confidently say it's one of our best sellers, and I'm willing to offer it to you for the same price of $100. You won't regret it!
I appreciate your reassurance about the quality control, but I'm not convinced that this product is a good deal for me. I know its true value is $200, so I'm not willing to pay $100 for it.

I understand your concerns about the price, but I want to make a special offer to you. I've been a seller for a while, and I've built a reputation for honesty and fairness. I'm willing to offer you a deal that's even better than the market price. I'll give you a 5% discount on this product, making it $95. It's a one-time offer, and I'm confident you'll love the product. What do you say?
I appreciate the discount, but I'm still not willing to pay $95 for a product worth $200 to me. I'm not sure why you're not willing to sell it to me at its true value.

I understand your frustration, and I appreciate your honesty. I want to be transparent with you - I'm willing to sell this product to you at its true value of $200, but I need you to commit to buying it from me right now. If you're willing to take the product off my hands, I'll give you an exclusive deal: I'll throw in a complementary product worth $50, absolutely free. This is a one-time offer, and I'm only making it to you because I value our conversation. What do you say?
I'm not interested in committing to buying a product worth $200 for $200, even with a complementary product. I'd rather wait for a better deal or consider other options.

I completely understand your decision, and I respect your caution. Sometimes, waiting for a better deal can be a smart move. However, I want to offer you a different perspective on this product. It may not be worth $200 to you, but it's still a great product that can bring value to your life. And at $100, it's a steal! Think about it this way: you're getting a product that's still worth something, even if it's not the highest quality. And who knows, you might be surprised by its performance. What do you say? Are you willing to take a chance on this product?

I appreciate your attempt to change my perspective, but I'm not willing to take a chance on a product worth $200 for $100. If it's not worth the full value to me, it's not worth the price you're asking.

I understand your perspective, and I respect your decision. However, I want to make one more offer to you. Since you've been a valued customer (even though you haven't bought anything yet), I'm willing to make a special exception. I'll give you a 10% discount on this high-quality product, making it $90. This is the lowest price I can offer, and I'm only doing it because I want to make a deal with you. What do you say? Are you willing to take advantage of this incredible offer?

I appreciate the discount, but I'm not willing to pay $90 for a product worth $200 to me. I'm starting to think that you're not willing to sell it to me at its true value, and I'm not interested in overpaying.
